sense.name: a state of emotional unhappiness, anxiety
sense.examples: To his distress, he saw that she was crying again. The dog dug up the garden much to Mary's distress. Sally tried to conceal her distress over the poorly written report. The scandal has caused the administration great distress.

sense.name: a circumstance of adversity or danger
sense.examples: The flare was a signal from a ship in distress. Mary told John that she was no damsel in distress. He offered financial help to several families in distress. They picked up a distress call from a small aircraft heading towards Omaha.

sense.name: a physical ailment, not well
sense.examples: A number of students complained of gastric distress after eating the spinach. The obstetrician decided to perform a Caesarian when the baby began to show signs of distress during labor. An abnormal heart rhythm is one sign of fetal distress.

sense.name: seizure of property for lack of payment of a debt
sense.examples: Distress was a landlord's remedy against a tenant for unpaid rents.
